List of cached statistics, all bands mixed.

memberdef.name: bandStatistics

briefdescription.para: Returns the band statistics.

parameterdescription.para: Extent used to calc statistics, if empty, whole raster extent is used.
Approximate number of cells in sample. If 0, all cells (whole raster will be used). If raster does not have exact size (WCS without exact size for example), provider decides size of sample.

memberdef.argsstring: (int bandNo, const QgsRectangle &extent, int width, int height, QgsRasterBlockFeedback *feedback=nullptr)=0
memberdef.name: block

briefdescription.para: Read block of data using given extent and size.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns pointer to data. Caller is responsible to free the memory returned.
bandNo
band number
extent
extent of block
width
pixel width of block
height
pixel height of block
feedback
optional raster feedback object for cancelation/preview. Added in QGIS 3.0.

Clone itself, create deep copy.

memberdef.name: cumulativeCut

briefdescription.para: Find values for cumulative pixel count cut.

parameterdescription.para: The lower count as fraction of 1, e.g. 0.02 = 2%
The upper count as fraction of 1, e.g. 0.98 = 98%
Location into which the lower value will be set.
Location into which the upper value will be set.

Approximate number of cells in sample. If 0, all cells (whole raster will be used). If raster does not have exact size (WCS without exact size for example), provider decides size of sample.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if histogram is available (cached, already calculated).

listitem.para:
The parameters are the same as in bandStatistics()
true if statistics are available (ready to use)

memberdef.argsstring: (int bandNo, int binCount=0, double minimum=std::numeric_limits< double >::quiet_NaN(), double maximum=std::numeric_limits< double >::quiet_NaN(), const QgsRectangle &extent=QgsRectangle(), int sampleSize=0, bool includeOutOfRange=false, QgsRasterBlockFeedback *feedback=nullptr)
memberdef.name: histogram

briefdescription.para: Returns a band histogram.

detaileddescription.para:
Histograms are cached in providers.
bandNo
The band (number).
binCount
Number of bins (intervals,buckets). If 0, the number of bins is decided automatically according to data type, raster size etc.
minimum
Minimum value, if NaN (None for Python), raster minimum value will be used.
maximum
Maximum value, if NaN (None for Python), raster maximum value will be used.
extent
Extent used to calc histogram, if empty, whole raster extent is used.
sampleSize
Approximate number of cells in sample. If 0, all cells (whole raster will be used). If raster does not have exact size (WCS without exact size for example), provider decides size of sample.
includeOutOfRange
include out of range values
feedback
optional feedback object
Vector of non NULL cell counts for each bin.
binCount, minimum and maximum not optional in Python bindings

briefdescription.para: Current input.
Returns whether the interface is on or off.
Sets base class members from xml. Usually called from create() methods of subclasses.
Set input.

detaileddescription.para: Returns true if set correctly, false if cannot use that input

briefdescription.para: Sets whether the interface is on or off.
Returns source data type for the band specified by number, source data type may be shorter than dataType.
Gets source / raw input, the first in pipe, usually provider.

detaileddescription.para:
It may be used to get info about original data, e.g. resolution to decide resampling etc.
not available in Python bindings.

briefdescription.para: Gets source / raw input, the first in pipe, usually provider.

detaileddescription.para: It may be used to get info about original data, e.g. resolution to decide resampling etc.

briefdescription.para: Write base class members to xml.
Gets block size.
Gets raster size.
